Package gameObject.animal

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
gameObject.GameObject
gameObject.MovableObject
gameObject.animal.Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Actable, Movable, ObservableAnimal, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Animal
extends MovableObject
implements ObservableAnimal
Animal is the antity of the player in the frogger game.

Player controls the animal by pressing 'W', 'A', 'S' and 'D' on keyboard to move the frogger in the game scene. It has a model which saves all information about the object of Animal. It has a view which saves all images about Animal. Both model and view of animal have no relationship with other components and have no control of other modules. It has position setter, level controller, death controller, key event handler, intersection processor and the reference to its observers. Whenever higher level of controllers call the method, updateScore(), in Animal, it updates the score in AnimalModel and notifies all listeners (BoardController) to update information in BoardView and BoardModel. The Animal class uses Singleton design pattern to make it globally accessible to all other modules and components.

  • Field Details

    • instance

      private static Animal instance
      Singleton instance.

    • animalView

      private AnimalView animalView
      The images of Animal.

    • animalModel

      private AnimalModel animalModel
      The Animal model which keeps all information about the animal object.

    • animalPositionSetter

      private AnimalPositionSetter animalPositionSetter
      Animal position setter sets the coordinate and position of the animal. It needs the control of the whole Animal. It has the reference to the Animal object.

    • animalLevelController

      private AnimalLevelController animalLevelController
      Controls the animal and updates corresponding information of animal when player enter the next level.

    • animalDeathController

      private AnimalDeathController animalDeathController
      Animal's death controller handles the status changes and view changes after the Animal is dead.

    • animalKeyEventInitializer

      private AnimalKeyEventInitializer animalKeyEventInitializer
      It initializes player's key event.

    • animalIntersectionProcessor

      private AnimalIntersectionProcessor animalIntersectionProcessor
      The processor of animal intersection handles intersection with every kind of object in the game.

    • animalObservers

      private java.util.ArrayList<AnimalObserver> animalObservers
      Observers of Animal. When the score or lives of the animal object changes, observers will be notified.

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      private Animal()
      Creates an Animal object.

      The constructor uses composition to create several modules that owned by the Animal object. It creates an Animal with 5 lives(default) but developers could manually change it in this contructors. It creates an Animal view. It creates several controllers. It creates an array list of all listeners. It resets the Animal object including the position, status and image view of the object. The constructor is a private constructor because Singleton is applied on Animal. Only one instance of Animal is allowed to create and exists. To create an Animal instance, the method, getInstance() will be called to get the single instance.

  • Method Details

    • getInstace

      public static Animal getInstace()
      Using Singleton design pattern to get the only instance of Animal.

      In this case, all modules anc components can access to the Animal instance and the information about Animal can be synchronized.

      Returns:
      the only Singleton Animal object.

    • clearInstance

      public static void clearInstance()
      Clear the only instance of Animal.

      When player ends the game and wants to restart the game, the previous Animal instance should be cleared so that other components won't access to the old Animal instance.

    • act

      public void act​(long now)
      Checks if the animal oversteps the boundary of the game, handles the animal's intersection with other game objects and checks the status of the animal.

      It runs in every frame to make the game continuously.

      Specified by:
      act in interface Actable
      Parameters:
      now - the current time

    • resetAnimal

      public void resetAnimal()
      Sets the animal to the original position, sets the animal to live and sets the image of the animal.

      This is normally called when the animal dies or reaches the end destination.

    • resetImage

      public void resetImage()
      Sets the image of Animal to the alive image.

      This is normally called when the animal dies or reaches the end destination.

    • updateScore

      public void updateScore​(int difference)
      Changes the score of the animal and notifies all observers.

      It calls the method, increasePoints(), in animal model to make changes on the score of the animal. It notifies all observers by calling the method, notifyAnimalObserver(), to update corresponding information. It accepts positive or negative integers.

      Parameters:
      difference - increament or decrement of Animal's score

    • register

      public void register​(AnimalObserver newObserver)
      Adds a new observer to the array list.
      Specified by:
      register in interface ObservableAnimal
      Parameters:
      newObserver - the new animal observer that observes Animal

    • unregister

      public void unregister​(AnimalObserver deleteObserver)
      Removes a new observer from the array list.
      Specified by:
      unregister in interface ObservableAnimal
      Parameters:
      deleteObserver - the deleted animal observer that observes Animal

    • notifyAnimalObserver

      public void notifyAnimalObserver()
      Notifies all animal observers to update the score and the number of lives of the animal.

      It calls update() method defined in AnimalObserver interface. Observers get the new score and new number of lives.

      Specified by:
      notifyAnimalObserver in interface ObservableAnimal
